text: Depends on how frequently you access it. :) Intelligent tiering, one zone (if you don't care about risk of data loss), and even glacier might all be good candidates. Depends on what you're doing so go IA and if you find yourself accessing more frequently, change?

text: On the topic of AWS or other cloud approaches, what do people consider the main benefits? What does it give you over a good old fashioned server hire other than (presumably) lower cost. I've been working on dockerising my stuff ready for AWS deployment and reading about various types. There is a bewildering array of options but cost aside, the only reason I will be going down this route is more reliable internet connectivity but I could get that getting a dedicated server hire (although admittedly more expensive). I must be missing something because I can't see the allure of AWS other than improved connection reliability. Can someone educate me?

elements.text: On the topic of AWS or other cloud approaches, what do people consider the main benefits? What does it give you over a good old fashioned server hire other than (presumably) lower cost. I've been working on dockerising my stuff ready for AWS deployment and reading about various types. There is a bewildering array of options but cost aside, the only reason I will be going down this route is more reliable internet connectivity but I could get that getting a dedicated server hire (although admittedly more expensive). I must be missing something because I can't see the allure of AWS other than improved connection reliability. Can someone educate me?

text: Not one I can comment on TBH, but yeah, market is always progressing. :)

elements.text: Not one I can comment on TBH, but yeah, market is always progressing. :)

text: The high-level benefits (beyond reliability), are briefly touched on here: <https://aws.amazon.com/what-is-aws/|https://aws.amazon.com/what-is-aws/>

attachments.fallback: Amazon Web Services, Inc.: What is AWS
attachments.text: Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform, offering over 200 fully featured services from data centers globally.
attachments.title: What is AWS

text: Flexibility

elements.text: Flexibility

text: What do you mean by that <@UBS7QANF3> ? In regards to changing resource configurations in comparison to physical hardware ?

elements.text: What do you mean by that
? In regards to changing resource configurations in comparison to physical hardware ?

text: Yes. Need an extra server? You can have one in seconds, no contract to sign, no need to wait for your hosting provider to provision it or - God forbid - order the hardware. And there are all kinds of niche configurations available e.g. GPU or FPGA instances. If you want to relocate your infrastructure half way around the world, you can do it in seconds. You can scale down just as easily as scaling up. You're not tied into a contract or stuck with last gen hardware. And these are the benefits of just the EC2 product

elements.text: Yes. Need an extra server? You can have one in seconds, no contract to sign, no need to wait for your hosting provider to provision it or - God forbid - order the hardware. And there are all kinds of niche configurations available e.g. GPU or FPGA instances. If you want to relocate your infrastructure half way around the world, you can do it in seconds. You can scale down just as easily as scaling up. You're not tied into a contract or stuck with last gen hardware. And these are the benefits of just the EC2 product

text:
I was listening to the BBC Sounds podcast this morning about the Lazarus group in North Korea (Cybercrime Group), there are 10 episodes in total. They are considered to be the team behind the Sony hack and wannacry,  though it may interest a few folk on here.
<https://www.bbc.co.uk/sounds/play/p09m14pt>

attachments.fallback: bbc: The Lazarus Heist - 10. Kill switch - BBC Sounds
attachments.text: A frightening global attack, hospitals in chaos and an accidental hero with a secret
attachments.title: The Lazarus Heist - 10. Kill switch - BBC Sounds
